data.title: Nice Visitor Center in Historic Santa Fe Passenger Train Depot on Route 66
data.text:
We went to the Flagstaff Convention and Visitor Center.  Its located in the historic Santa Fe passenger train deport on Route 66.  One can watch the freight trains go by.

The staff is very helpful and gave us lots of tips on what to see while in the area.
They also gave us literature and maps to help with our visit.

data.title: Extremely knowledgeable staff!!
data.text: We've never been to Flagstaff before and I had this place first up when we arrived as a central place to gather information about the area. These types of places are hit or miss when traveling. You either get a little old lady (sorry) sitting there not being helpful or you get a place like this. They were fully staffed with several people to answer the most quirky of questions from tourists. The two men who helped us were just outstanding. You first got the standard formal answers to our questions and then they would tell you what they thought of each place we wanted to visit, when to get there, what to avoid and what to make sure we seen. If we could have adopted one of them for our trip we would have.  If you plan on visiting the many Federal and state parks in the area the one key question to ask the staff are about the fee's to get into the park's. Not as easy as it sounds. They will walk you through how to combine passes and save the most money on the entrance fee's while maximizing your experiences. This place will give you information not found on any website. Plenty of brochures, maps and souvenirs to purchase as well. It's also in the downtown area of old Flagstaff so plenty of restaurants and shops to go visit after you are done there.

data.title: THANK YOU !
data.text: I won passes to Hullabaloo Festival (fantastic family fun - lots of activities for children of all ages, big and small - great music and food) and a stay at Little America from the tourism dept.and we had such a fun time. Can't wait for next June of next year to come to the festival again. Will be back a lot sooner though as out stay at Little America was amazing and there is so much to do here. Thank you again.

data.title: Difficult to Find & Not Much to Offer
data.text: The visitor's bureau in Flagstaff is not user friendly. The staff are rude and put out if asked questions.  There is little found about the attractions located in and around Flagstaff. Recommend that you don't waste your time. Ask locals sitting outside of a restaurant or bar where things are and what they recommend!

data.title: Get all the information you need, so you don't miss a thing in Flagstaff
data.text: Stopping by the Train Station (Visitor Center) should always be your first stop when visiting Flagstaff.  The staff is superbly trained to offer you suggestions and things not to miss.  There are tons of brochures and maps available.  They also have a nice little gift shop where you can pick up reasonable priced souvenirs.  Take a few minutes to sit outside and watch the trains go by.  A true Flagstaff experience.

data.title: Should Be Your First Stop In Flagstaff
data.text: Go here first and finding your way around Flagstaff will be much easier. Very helpful personnel ,maps and literature and some nice souvenir items in a n historic train depot.

data.title: Great place to start!
data.text:
This is a great place to start.  They have information on about everything to do in Flagstaff. The staff is extremely friendly.
There is a lot to see in and around Flagstaff so I highly recommend you have them help you plan your visit.

data.title: Gave me some ideas on what to do
data.text: THE people at the visitors bureau gave me some ideas on what to do and answered all the questions I had. The man gave me the maps that I needed and suggested some things to do that I had not heard of..
